stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds‚Äîpart arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.

stadium.name: The Sun-Baked Bowl
stadium.description: A simple, deep bowl dug from clay and sandstone on the edge of a caravan oasis. The heat is oppressive, and the 'stands' are just blankets laid on the sun-baked dunes.

stats.pregame_ritual: Eating a piece of honeycomb to 'sweeten' their victory.
Smelling a piece of burnt wood from a campfire.
Methodically tearing a large leaf into tiny, identical pieces.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Humming a tune they believe only they know.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.
Shaving one half of their mustache for important games.
Consulting a folk rhyme about the weather to predict the game's outcome.
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Trying to teach a stray dog a complicated and useless new trick.
Tugging on their left earlobe three times.

preGame:
Hello, hello, hello, you beautiful monsters and bloodthirsty bettors! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the Oakmaul Grounds in Hafting for a Tuesday Night Trollball classic! We are kicking off the Losers Bracket of the playoffs, and the air is thick with the sweet, metallic scent of desperation and pre-game sweat! It is Game 1 of a Best-of-3 series, and let me tell you, folks, there is nothing like the playoffs to bring out the absolute worst in everyone‚Äîand I mean that in the most delightful way possible! üèüÔ∏èüèÜ

In the Away dugout, we have The Desert Spectres! These dusty brawlers are looking to haunt the scoreboard tonight. I just saw Angelita Darce backstage shaving off half his mustache‚Äîa true sign of a man ready for war! Meanwhile, Muscolo Jaehne is busy tearing leaves into tiny, identical pieces. It‚Äôs that kind of focus that wins championships, or at least ensures someone‚Äôs getting a Kirkhammer to the teeth! They‚Äôve got Geth the Gravelord in their corner, and you know that old frenemy of mine loves a good pile of bones. üåµüíÄ

But look at the home side, The Greenwatch! They‚Äôre stepping onto the hallowed ground of the Oakmaul Grounds, where the shadows of the scarred oak remind us all that life is fleeting, but Trollball is eternal! Madea Mensch is already hopping to the starting line with his laces tied together‚Äîtalk about dedication to the craft! And Nobe Haukom? He‚Äôs going around plucking hairs from his teammates' beards for luck. That‚Äôs the kind of grit the Wardens like Sir Randy and his fancy, over-priced bow just don‚Äôt understand. Give me a good old-fashioned Mallet any day! üå≥üî®

Now, I‚Äôll try to keep it down the middle, folks, but my heart is always with the Ebon Gate Corruptors. Still, seeing these two battle it out in the Losers Bracket is a treat! The Greenwatch fans are out in force, probably hoping for a ritual victory under the oak, while the Spectres fans are... well, they‚Äôre here, and they‚Äôre thirsty! It‚Äôs playoff time in Osterra, where the hits are harder and the healers are busier than a one-armed goblin in a gold mine! Let‚Äôs get to the carnage! ü¶¥üí•
postGame:
Holy cow, what a humdinger! If you like your sports with a side of internal bleeding and a main course of overtime drama, then tonight was your Christmas! The Greenwatch have defended their home turf at the Oakmaul Grounds, edging out The Desert Spectres with a final score of 5 to 4! It was a seesaw of violence that would make even my boss, Lord Orzalon, crack a smile in his prison cell! üé§üî•

The action was fast and furious from the jump! After a quick halftime breather, Bahr Ethelstan snagged the leather and looked ready to rumble, but the defense was stickier than a honey-coated billhook. Madea Mensch showed us why he‚Äôs a fan favorite, absolutely leveling Shelman McQuoid early on. That‚Äôs the kind of physical play we love to see‚Äîjust pure, unadulterated brutality right in the middle of the field! ü§ïüí™

The Greenwatch found their rhythm midway through the half when Drona Jacklin intercepted a wild pass from Fidellia Mozelle. Drona didn't hesitate, lining up a spectacular shot from Center Field to put the first points on the board! Not to be outdone, Herriott Dhiren followed up with another long-range beauty before getting absolutely flattened by Eileen Mikihisa. It‚Äôs a game of give and take, folks, and Herriott gave the points and took a trip to the healer! üéØüöë

The Spectres wouldn't go quietly into that good night, though! Heyes Iver, the man with the woodsman‚Äôs axe, was a one-man wrecking crew. He notched a brilliant 2-point shot from Center Field to keep things tight and spent the rest of his time turning Greenwatch players into floor mats. He personally sent Darin Berliner to the sidelines with a tackle that rattled the teeth of everyone in the front row! ü™ìüí•

As the clock ticked down, the tension was higher than the bar tab at one of Imra‚Äôs parties! We headed into Overtime, and the Oakmaul Grounds lived up to its name. The 'Ritual Focus' of the stadium seemed to sharpen the blades and the tempers. Eileen Mikihisa was a demon on the field, trying to carry the Spectres on his back, but every time he made a move, a Greenwatch mallet was there to greet him! ‚è≥‚öîÔ∏è

The injury report for this game looks like a grocery list for a necromancer! We saw Bahr Ethelstan, Madea Mensch, Verne Methuselah, and Huesman Ring all carted off at various points in the extra period. It was a war of attrition, and frankly, I haven‚Äôt seen this much carnage since the last time Sir Artorias tried to ‚Äòsave‚Äô a village! The fans were screaming, the healers were sweating, and the Trollball was slick with... well, let's call it 'effort.' ü©∏üè•

Drona Jacklin was everywhere in the final minutes, dealing out punishment like a Guild of the Black Sky tax collector. She put Lovash Marius out of commission with a tackle that surely broke a few records and maybe a few ribs. It‚Äôs that kind of playoff intensity that separates the legends from the losers, and the Greenwatch were playing like they had a direct line to the Green Goddess herself! üåø‚ö°

The Spectres had their chances in Away Field, but the goal seemed to have a curse on it! Shelman McQuoid and Eileen Mikihisa both missed crucial shots that could have ended it. You could see the frustration on their faces‚Äîor at least on the half of Angelita Darce's face that he didn't shave! They fought like cornered wolves, but the Greenwatch defense held firm under the shadow of the great oak. üê∫üö´

The finale was a thing of pure, tactical beauty. With the defense worn thin, Madea Mensch found a gap and zipped a pass to Nobe Haukom, who was waiting in the End Zone. Nobe didn't just score; he dunked that troll head into the goal like he was putting a rowdy guest to bed! The crowd erupted, the Spectres collapsed, and the Greenwatch walked away with the Game 1 victory! üèÄüôå

What a way to start the series! The Greenwatch take a 1-0 lead, leaving The Desert Spectres looking a bit more like ghosts than usual. If the Spectres want to stay in this Best-of-3, they‚Äôre going to need more than just honeycombs and burnt wood rituals; they‚Äôre going to need some serious grit! As for me, I‚Äôm going to go see if I can find where Kuromi is hiding the victory drinks. Stay tuned, sports fans, because the Everwar might keep you from dying, but Trollball makes you feel alive! üçªüéâ
